intro: Diplostephium costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
